page.title: 01Hills Northeast of Ludlow
page.content: The block covers part of a low, scarp like spur extending Southwest from Brown Clee Hill. It is fairly level along the ridge, about 240m, in West and about 160m in southeast. It is drained by streams cut deep and generally flowing east into the Hopton Brook which feeds the Ledwyche Brook flowing south. the only routes, lanes, sometiems narrow and twisting with high hedgerows, run along the ridge or lower down, parallel,and one connects the two WEst- East. The population is small and dispersed with only one hamlet some farms, cottages, a few new houses and one hall at Downton. Farming is largely concerned with the grazing of sheep and cattle, with some ploughed land mainly for cereals.
